proceduralStep.title: Daily Check Overview
proceduralStep.para: This procedure describes the Daily Check inspection to be performed before the first flight of each operating day. The Daily Check ensures the aircraft is in a safe and airworthy condition for flight operations.
The Daily Check typically takes 1-2 hours and consists primarily of visual inspections and basic fluid level checks. This check may be performed at the gate or on the ramp.

proceduralStep.title: Pre-Check Requirements
proceduralStep.para: Before beginning the Daily Check, verify the following:

listItem.para: Aircraft technical log is available and reviewed
All open discrepancies have been reviewed and cleared or deferred
Weather conditions are suitable for exterior inspection
Aircraft is parked in a safe location with chocks in place
Qualified line maintenance personnel are performing the check

proceduralStep.title: Walk-Around Inspection - Nose Section
proceduralStep.para: Beginning at the nose, perform the following inspections:

listItem.para: Check nose radome for damage, secure attachment, and cleanliness
Inspect windshield and side windows for cracks, crazing, or delamination
Check pitot tubes and static ports for damage and obstructions
Verify nose landing gear condition, tire wear, and proper extension
Check for hydraulic fluid leaks around nose gear
Inspect wheel wells for cleanliness and absence of foreign objects

proceduralStep.title: Walk-Around Inspection - Right Side
proceduralStep.para: Proceed to the right side of the aircraft:

listItem.para: Inspect right forward fuselage for skin damage, dents, or corrosion
Check all door seals and proper closure of passenger and service doors
Inspect right wing leading edge for damage and ice accumulation
Check right wing fuel vent for obstructions
Verify right wing tip navigation lights are intact and secure
Inspect right main landing gear, tires, brakes, and hydraulic lines
Check right wing trailing edge and control surfaces for damage
Verify right aileron and flap are properly secured and undamaged

proceduralStep.title: Walk-Around Inspection - Right Engine
proceduralStep.para: Inspect the right engine and nacelle:

listItem.para: Check engine cowling for secure attachment and damage
Inspect for fluid leaks (oil, fuel, hydraulic)
Verify fan blades are undamaged and free of foreign object damage
Check engine air inlet for obstructions and damage
Inspect thrust reverser components for proper stowage
Check pylon attachment for security and no visible damage
Inspect horizontal stabilizer for damage and proper attachment
Check elevator for damage and freedom of movement
Inspect vertical stabilizer and rudder for damage
Verify tail navigation lights are intact and secure
Check APU exhaust and air inlet for damage and obstructions
Inspect aft fuselage for skin damage and loose fasteners

proceduralStep.title: Walk-Around Inspection - Left Engine
proceduralStep.para: Inspect the left engine and nacelle:

listItem.para: Check engine cowling for secure attachment and damage
Inspect for fluid leaks (oil, fuel, hydraulic)
Verify fan blades are undamaged and free of foreign object damage
Check engine air inlet for obstructions and damage
Inspect thrust reverser components for proper stowage
Check pylon attachment for security and no visible damage

proceduralStep.title: Walk-Around Inspection - Left Side
proceduralStep.para: Complete the walk-around on the left side:

listItem.para: Inspect left wing trailing edge and control surfaces for damage
Verify left aileron and flap are properly secured and undamaged
Inspect left main landing gear, tires, brakes, and hydraulic lines
Check left wing fuel vent for obstructions
Verify left wing tip navigation lights are intact and secure
Inspect left wing leading edge for damage and ice accumulation
Check all door seals and proper closure of passenger and service doors
Inspect left forward fuselage for skin damage, dents, or corrosion
Engine oil levels - Check and record levels, add oil if required
Hydraulic system fluid - Check reservoir levels
Check for any unusual fluid accumulation in drain masts
Record the Daily Check completion in the aircraft technical log
Document any discrepancies found during the inspection
Coordinate with flight crew regarding any findings
Enter inspection data in AAMMPP system
Sign off the Daily Check as complete and serviceable
